title: RHEL9 images do not have us_US.UTF-8

labels.name: P3
labels.description: We're not considering working on this, but happy to review a PR. (No assignee)

labels.name: team-OSS
labels.description: Issues for the Bazel OSS team: installation, release processBazel packaging, website

labels.name: help wanted
labels.description: Someone outside the Bazel team could own this

body:
### Description of the bug:


While running bazel build in the containers based on the RHEL9 with glibc-minimal - the build fails because it tries to set up locale to us_US.UTF-8 however this package provides on C.UTF-8

static final ImmutableMap<String, String> UTF8_ENVIRONMENT =
      ImmutableMap.of("LC_CTYPE", "en_US.UTF-8");

https://github.com/search?q=repo%3Abazelbuild%2Fbazel+UTF8_ENVIRONMENT&type=code

See the references:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2000878



### Which category does this issue belong to?


External Dependency, Local Execution

### What's the simplest, easiest way to reproduce this bug? Please provide a minimal example if possible.


Create a docker image based on the registry.access.redhat.com/ubi9/ubi-minimal:9.1.0-1829
Add Bazel with some simple Java project and try to build.

### Which operating system are you running Bazel on?


ubi-minimal:9.1.0-1829

### What is the output of `bazel info release`?


release 6.1.0

### If `bazel info release` returns `development version` or `(@non-git)`, tell us how you built Bazel.


_No response_

### What's the output of `git remote get-url origin; git rev-parse master; git rev-parse HEAD` ?


```text
private repository
```


### Is this a regression? If yes, please try to identify the Bazel commit where the bug was introduced.


not sure

### Have you found anything relevant by searching the web?

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2000878

https://github.com/osbuild/osbuild-composer/issues/2206
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1958876
